| An enormous rat:* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* normally appears in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). |                   |

An **enormous rat**, r, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears as part of the [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") patch incorporated in [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack") and older versions of [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"). The **enormous rat**, r, also appears in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). An enormous rat is a [small](/wiki/Small "Small") [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that is slightly larger than other early [rodents](/wiki/Rodent "Rodent"), and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). Like other [rats](/wiki/Rat "Rat"), Convicts can pacify or tame them by [chatting](/wiki/Chatting "Chatting") to one.

An enormous rat has a single bite attack.

## Generation

Randomly generated enormous rats are always hostile, and may appear in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). A giant rat can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into an enormous rat, and an enormous rat can grow up into a [rodent of unusual size](/wiki/Rodent_of_unusual_size_\(DynaHack\) "Rodent of unusual size (DynaHack)").

Enormous rats appear among the random r that are part of the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") and make up 24‚ÅÑ175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Healer quest](/wiki/Healer_quest "Healer quest"). They also appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for Convicts and make up 24‚ÅÑ175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Convict quest](/wiki/Convict_quest "Convict quest"). Enormous rats additionally appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for [Pirates](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate") and make up 24‚ÅÑ175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Pirate quest](/wiki/Pirate_quest "Pirate quest").

In SlashTHEM, enormous rats appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for [Yeomen](/wiki/Yeomen "Yeomen") and make up 24‚ÅÑ175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Yeoman quest](/wiki/Yeoman_quest "Yeoman quest").

## Encyclopedia entry

Rats are long-tailed rodents. They are aggressive,  
omnivorous, and adaptable, often carrying diseases.  
\[]  
  
"The rat," said O'Brien, still addressing his invisible  
audience, "although a rodent, is carnivorous. You are aware  
of that. You will have heard of the things that happen in  
the poor quarters of this town. In some streets a woman dare  
not leave her baby alone in the house, even for five minutes.  
The rats are certain to attack it. Within quite a small time  
they will strip it to the bones. They also attack sick or  
dying people. They show astonishing intelligence in knowing  
when a human being is helpless."  
\[ 1984, by George Orwell ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Enormous_rat_\(DynaHack\)\&action=edit)*

Enormous rat (DynaHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
r enormous rat
Difficulty 4
Attacks Bite 1d6 physical
r enormous rat
Difficulty 4
Attacks

Bite 1d6 physical

Base level 3
Base experience 28
Speed 9
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 200
Nutritional value 100
Size small
Resistances none
Resistances conveyed none

An enormous rat:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • normally appears in small groups.

An enormous rat, r, is a type of monster that appears as part of the Convict patch incorporated in DynaHack and older versions of UnNetHack. The enormous rat, r, also appears in SpliceHack and SlashTHEM. An enormous rat is a small carnivorous animal that is slightly larger than other early rodents, and can be seen via infravision. Like other rats, Convicts can pacify or tame them by chatting to one.

An enormous rat has a single bite attack.

Generation

Randomly generated enormous rats are always hostile, and may appear in small groups. A giant rat can grow up into an enormous rat, and an enormous rat can grow up into a rodent of unusual size.

Enormous rats appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for Healers and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Healer quest. They also appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for Convicts and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Convict quest. Enormous rats additionally appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for Pirates and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Pirate quest.

In SlashTHEM, enormous rats appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for Yeomen and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Yeoman quest.

Encyclopedia entry

Rats are long-tailed rodents. They are aggressive,
omnivorous, and adaptable, often carrying diseases.
[]

"The rat," said O'Brien, still addressing his invisible
audience, "although a rodent, is carnivorous. You are aware
of that. You will have heard of the things that happen in
the poor quarters of this town. In some streets a woman dare
not leave her baby alone in the house, even for five minutes.
The rats are certain to attack it. Within quite a small time
they will strip it to the bones. They also attack sick or
dying people. They show astonishing intelligence in knowing
when a human being is helpless."
[ 1984, by George Orwell ]

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

An '''enormous rat''', {{red|r}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears as part of the [[Convict]] patch incorporated in [[DynaHack]] and older versions of [[UnNetHack]]. The '''enormous rat''', {{monsym|enormous rat}}, also appears in [[SpliceHack]] and [[SlashTHEM]]. An enormous rat is a [[small]] [[carnivorous]] [[animal]] that is slightly larger than other early [[rodent]]s, and can be seen via [[infravision]]. Like other [[rat]]s, Convicts can pacify or tame them by [[chatting]] to one.

An enormous rat has a single bite attack.

==Generation==
Randomly generated enormous rats are always hostile, and may appear in small [[group]]s. A giant rat can [[grow up]] into an enormous rat, and an enormous rat can grow up into a [[Rodent of unusual size (DynaHack)|rodent of unusual size]].

Enormous rats appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first [[quest]] [[monster class]] for [[Healer]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Healer quest]]. They also appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first quest monster class for Convicts and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Convict quest]]. Enormous rats additionally appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first quest monster class for [[Pirate]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Pirate quest]].

In SlashTHEM, enormous rats appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first quest monster class for [[Yeomen]] and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Yeoman quest]].

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
	Rats are long-tailed rodents.  They are aggressive,
	omnivorous, and adaptable, often carrying diseases.
		[]

	"The rat," said O'Brien, still addressing his invisible
	audience, "although a rodent, is carnivorous.  You are aware
	of that.  You will have heard of the things that happen in
	the poor quarters of this town.  In some streets a woman dare
	not leave her baby alone in the house, even for five minutes.
	The rats are certain to attack it.  Within quite a small time
	they will strip it to the bones.  They also attack sick or
	dying people.  They show astonishing intelligence in knowing
	when a human being is helpless."
		[ 1984, by George Orwell ]
}}{{stub}}
